clinicalDescription: Overview: Systemic inflammatory response syndrome in the presence of infection Presentation: Fever, tachycardia, elevated respiratory rate, abnormal white blood count. Severely ill Assessment: Blood, urine, sputum cultures, wound cultures if a wound present, lumbar puncture if indicated clinically,lactate level. Plan: Treat underlying infection, steroids and pressors (for blood pressure maintenance), IV fluids, respiratory support Prognosis: Frequently fatal. Worse outcome when end organ damage occurs due to low blood flow. Sequential Organ Failure Assessment: Score (SOFA) score used to predict severity.
